intro: Peperomia huantana var. enenyasana, commonly known as the Huantana enenyasana, is a rare and unique species native to the cloud forests of Ecuador. It is characterized by its compact, bushy growth habit and distinctive, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, velvety texture. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species in its native range.
